title: Australia Post scores a Trump bump
text:
Australia Post should recover $48.5 million in losses because of a little-known deal to end Chinese postal subsidies – thanks to US president Donald Trump.

Chief executive Christine Holgate told a parliamentary committee on Tuesday that the Trump administration threatened to pull out of the peak international post organisation, the United Postal Union, if postal subsidies to China were not ended.

Christine Holgate said Australia Post delivered a record revenue of almost $7 billion. AAP

Before the China deal, countries including the United States, Australia and Canada would pay about $1.75 to deliver to China and Hong Kong, while China would pay $1 to deliver to Australia.

"Something like 70 per cent of our losses are actually on the China leg, and those in Hong Kong, I think, contribute another 15 per cent," Ms Holgate said.

Australia Post also reported a strong start to the fiscal year. In the first quarter of fiscal 2020, Australia Post flagged its highest non-Christmas quarter on record with a 7.6 per cent jump in revenue to $1.8 billion.
